com.aevi.authentication

Class AuthenticationRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.helpers.BundleWrapper
      • com.aevi.authentication.AuthenticationRequest

  • public class AuthenticationRequest
extends BundleWrapper
    The AuthenticationRequest object represents a user authentication request made to the Aevi platform. The request allows the user of the terminal to be identified (typically via a password entry screen) and if successful, returns one of the roles defined in the Role enum.
    See Also:
    TerminalConfiguration.isAuthenticationApiUsable()

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuthenticationRequest

        public AuthenticationRequest()
        Creates an AuthenticationRequest object supporting authentication against any role.

        Note that this method will not authenticate against the TECHNICIAN role is this is considered to be a specialised role primarily for platform use.

      • AuthenticationRequest

        public AuthenticationRequest(Role... roles)
        Creates an AuthenticationRequest object supporting authentication against specified roles.
        Parameters:
        roles - Role(s) that need(s) to be authenticated.

    • Method Detail

      • getRoles

        public Role[] getRoles()
        Gets the list of roles
        Returns:
        the Role(s) that need(s) to be authenticated.

      • createIntent

        public android.content.Intent createIntent()
        Creates an Intent that can be used to submit an Authentication Request to the Platform.
        Returns:
        an Intent that can be used to submit an Authentication Request

      • fromIntent

        public static AuthenticationRequest fromIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
                                        throws AeviRequestDataMissingException
        Builds a AuthenticationRequest sub class from the given request. If a valid request cannot be found from the Intent's extras, a AeviRequestDataMissingException exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        The AuthenticationRequest found in the given Intent.
        Throws:
        AeviRequestDataMissingException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Provides a String Representation of the Request.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String.
